Name: Gold Flask of King Psusennes the First
Description: This gold flask was used for the king's personal grooming. It formed a pair with the golden goblet.The body of the flask swells slightly toward the top before narrowing sharply to form a long slim neck. This neck resembles a column surmounted by a capital similar to a lotus flower. Five incised rings underline the attachment of the stem to the capital.Two cartouches are inscribed on the body of the flask.
